title: Spring Will Be Ruled By These 8 Bag Trends
description: We’re manifesting better weather by doing what we do best, shopping.
excerpt: We’re manifesting better weather by doing what we do best, shopping.
text: We’re halfway through February, so if you haven’t started shopping for warm weather, you’re behind the curve. When the world’s top designers debuted their spring/summer 2025 collections last September, we were on the frontlines, taking copious notes. Now that the dust has settled, and we’ve parsed through everything we saw to weed out those without staying power, we’re presenting the best spring bag trends, ahead. There were bear-shaped bags, nods to childhood, and outlandish styling. From Dolce & Gabbana dresses to Diesel scarves, everyone put their own spin on the boho element. As for purses, heavy hitters like Chanel, Dior, Hermès, Fendi, and Louis Vuitton all took part, signaling that accessories with movement are in this season. (And maybe a touch of zebra, while you’re at it...) Although houses like Bottega Veneta, Khaite, and Dries Van Noten showcased this via footwear on the runways, it was bags from Louis Vuitton and Jil Sander that really caught our attention. Khaite Lori Baguette BagSt. Agni Bon Bon BagDries Van Noten Snake-Effect Leather Tote BagJacquemus Le Petit CalinoBottega Veneta Mini PouchCool in Chrome launchmetrics.com/spotlight//LAUNCHMETRICS SPOTLIGHTLoewe’s spring/summer 2025 runway Who’s ready for fashion to get futuristic? Metallics have nearly become the new neutral in recent seasons, but this spring, we’re zeroing in on all things mirrored. Case in point: the chromatic bags on display at Tory Burch, Loewe, Toteme, Coperni, and more. Commuters rejoice, because these doctor bags can actually hold all your belongings. While houses like Dior and Prada leaned into the classic, almost bowler bag structure, designers like Michael Kors and Louis Vuitton opted for more briefcase-like silhouettes. If anything, get ready to double down on these rectangular forms, cleverly dubbed “East West” bags. Be it a shoulder bag like those at Prada and Miu Miu, a top handle from Brandon Maxwell, or a clutch like the one we saw at Bottega Veneta, this silhouette is as relevant as ever. html:
We’re halfway through February, so if you haven’t started shopping for warm weather, you’re behind the curve. When the world’s top designers debuted their spring/summer 2025 collections last September, we were on the frontlines, taking copious notes. Now that the dust has settled, and we’ve parsed through everything we saw to weed out those without staying power, we’re presenting the best spring bag trends, ahead.

    Mini Me

    Michael Kor’s spring/summer 2025 runway

    Part of what made September’s runways so exciting was all the whimsy. There were bear-shaped bags, nods to childhood, and outlandish styling. There’s no resisting the charm of these miniature bags that appeared at shows like Michael Kors, Fendi, and Stella McCartney.

    Ferragamo Hug Mini Charm

    Miu Miu Nappa Laminata Bag Charm

    JW Anderson Bumper 7 Mini Bag

    Coach Tabby Bag Charm

    Prada Mini Icon Re-Nylon bag charm

    On the Fringe

    Fendi’s spring/summer 2025 runway

    Fringe was all over the spring/summer runways, and not just as it pertains to bags. From Dolce & Gabbana dresses to Diesel scarves, everyone put their own spin on the boho element. As for purses, heavy hitters like Chanel, Dior, Hermès, Fendi, and Louis Vuitton all took part, signaling that accessories with movement are in this season.

    Chloé Foulard Fringed Leather Shoulder Bag

    Prada Galleria Mini-Bag with Feather Trim

    JW Anderson Medium Scarf Bag

    Stella McCartney Crystal Fringe Falabella Tiny Tote Bag

    Alaïa Mini Ring Fringe Bucket Bag

    Year of the Snake

    Louis Vuitton’s spring/summer 2025 runway

    Animal print is eternal, but 2025 is about reptilian varieties, specifically. (And maybe a touch of zebra, while you’re at it...) Although houses like Bottega Veneta, Khaite, and Dries Van Noten showcased this via footwear on the runways, it was bags from Louis Vuitton and Jil Sander that really caught our attention.

    Khaite Lori Baguette Bag

    St. Agni Bon Bon Bag

    Dries Van Noten Snake-Effect Leather Tote Bag

    Jacquemus Le Petit Calino

    Bottega Veneta Mini Pouch

    Cool in Chrome

    Loewe’s spring/summer 2025 runway

    Who’s ready for fashion to get futuristic? Metallics have nearly become the new neutral in recent seasons, but this spring, we’re zeroing in on all things mirrored. Case in point: the chromatic bags on display at Tory Burch, Loewe, Toteme, Coperni, and more.

    Proenza Schouler Silo Metallic Leather Shoulder Bag

    Cult Gaia Caldera Clutch

    Diesel Logo Metallic Leather Handbag

    Givenchy Shark Lock Bucket Bag

    Coperni Mini Sound Swipe Mirrored Bag

    The Doctor (Bag) Is In

    Louis Vuitton’s spring/summer 2025 runways

    It’s always a bonus when trends feature some practicality, so we know you’ll be excited about this next one. Commuters rejoice, because these doctor bags can actually hold all your belongings. While houses like Dior and Prada leaned into the classic, almost bowler bag structure, designers like Michael Kors and Louis Vuitton opted for more briefcase-like silhouettes.

    Khaite Cate Bag

    Dior Large D-Vibe Bowling Bag

    Prada Galleria Leather Bag

    The Row India Leather Tote Bag

    Loro Piana Sesia Happy Day Shoulder Bag

    East to West

    Prada’s spring/summer 2025 runway

    If you assumed this trend faded with the fall season, you thought wrong. If anything, get ready to double down on these rectangular forms, cleverly dubbed “East West” bags. Be it a shoulder bag like those at Prada and Miu Miu, a top handle from Brandon Maxwell, or a clutch like the one we saw at Bottega Veneta, this silhouette is as relevant as ever.

    Jil Sander Cannolo Bag

    Bottega Veneta East-West Arco Tote

    Alaïa Le Teckel

    Prada Bonnie Leather Handbag

    Staud Maude Shoulder Bag

    Canvas Meets Leather

    Hermès’ spring/summer 2025 runway

    Canvas and leather are a tried-and-true pairing, albeit historically overlooked—until now. Thom Browne, Valentino, and Gabriela Hearst were among the many runways where this dynamic duo could be found. Finally, canvas is getting its flowers this spring.

    Khaite Lia Bag

    Gabriela Hearst Leonora Flap Bag

    Michael Kors x 007 Bond Cotton Canvas and Leather Weekender Bag

    Il Bisonte Marini Drawstring Canvas Bucket Bag

    Polo Ralph Lauren Extra-Large Bellport Canvas Tote Bag

    Back to Buckets

    Gucci’s spring/summer 2025 runway

    Oh hello, bucket bags; we meet again. Everyone’s favorite bottomless pits are in full effect for this year’s spring/summer collections. Some took the form of drawstring bags, like at Off-White, Giambattista Valli, and Hermès, while others went for an open top, like Gucci and Prada.

    Gucci 73 Mini Bucket Bag

    Prada Leather Bucket Bag with Belt

    J.Crew Berkeley Bucket Bag

    Now 14% Off

    Jacquemus Le Petit Bambola Leather Bucket Bag

    Chloé Marcie Micro Bucket Bag

    Why Trust ELLE

    Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.
